data.title: Actors cannot support more than one type of cloak.
data.body:
This crash triggers if the actor has two instances of cloak and you unload it from an APC. As far as I know, multiple cloak traits are necessary to define different cloak types with different detection units for one, (nod cloaks gets detected by sensor arrays, but units with camouflage could be detected by any unit near it).

data.title: More sysinfo stuff
data.body: Closes #12630.

data.title: GarrisonCapture Trait Idea
data.body:
I figured this trait must have simply not been thought of to add to OpenRA yet since you guys are likely focusing on bigger things so here it is.

GarrisonCapture Trait: this allows a player to garrison a structure or unit and change the side/faction of said unit/structure to that of the side/faction of the units inside it.  I've seen this happen in the version of Red Alert and TS that came after the first versions where if you sent units into a building to garrison it the building would change to the side of those units with a few exceptions.  Like in the case of mind-controlled units where their faction/side on entry is used instead of their faction/side after once control over them has been returned to the original owner.

I figured this trait could be very handy to players that like to mess with the code and it'd also help with someone is building a city map and wants players to be able to send their units to take it over to slow down their enemies.


Also a side note idea for those of you that know how to mess with the AI's main C# code why not tell the AI to locate any structures/units that have empty garrison/cargo slots for units and tell it to randomly select correct units to fill those slots.  In the case of transports there could also be a trait to tell the AI to auto deploy them when close enough to an enemy force.  In both these AI ideas it does add a couple more traits for the players to mess with to let them change things up a bit.

As for the main idea of a GarrisonCapture Trait this will help open up some doors you may have been scratching your heads as to how to open. :)

D2K - Some description work
data.body:
Added about that Carryalls carry vehicles to repair pad to Carryall's Desc.

Removed unnecessary/wrong `Aircraft` from weak vs and strong vss

Added `when deployed` to thumper's desc.

Changed Freman's Desc, "armed with assault rifles and rockets" is a term from [Description of original game](http://www.mediafire.com/view/69sbi6wozu2kx82/Freman.png#).

Added dots after strucuture descs.

Added `Weak vs Tanks` to desc of Raider and Stealth Raider.

Fixed Combat Tank desc's Side Specific info. It is no longer true.

Removed `Requires power to operate` from Starport.

Removed Frigate's desc. It is unneseccary as it is unbuildable.

data.title: Replace "Debug" prefix with "Battlefield Control" for gameplay notifications.
data.body: This also introduces a `SuppressNotifications` flag that maps can use to disable the default messages if they want to display something different using Lua.

"Player" left do want to play in his place?

Will also help somewhat on spectators being auto kicked before game start.

Split from #12605 for easier reviewing.

Carried over +1 from #12605.

data.title: Engineer tries to repair enemy buildings
data.body:
When a building has been captured by an enemy and you haven't had vision of it since, an engineer will try to repair the building as-if it were still your building, i.e. with oil derricks, see example video taken from https://www.twitch.tv/videos/117999892.

http://sendvid.com/lfj5elhr

data.title: Add engine plumbing to support externally developed mods.
data.body:
This implements the next step towards #11813 and #12554 by adding plumbing to support externally developed mods:

* The `Engine.DefaultMod` launch argument allows mods to override the hardcoded switch to the modchooser when a mod isn't available.
* The `ModContent` section in mod.yaml is no longer required, and can now customize the behaviour when assets aren't available.
* The `Engine.ModSearchPaths` launch argument allows mods to override where the engine looks for mods.

These are used by the new [pchote/OpenRAModTemplate](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRAModTemplate) repository (which i'll move to the OpenRA org once this has been merged) which sets up a development/runtime/(eventually) packaging environment for third party mods.

Depends on #12600.  The first real commit in this PR is 5fcebb2.

data.title: TS explosions missing glow blend effect
data.body: In TS many explosions displayed an additional short glow effect. I believe it was an engine effect, but it would probably easier for us to use a sprite animation + alpha palette instead, which is already possible.

data.title: Introduce a TargetDamage warhead
data.body:
... that only deals damage to the projectile's target, at least if the projectile is an `InstantHit` projectile.

That would allow to avoid work-arounds for `Spread` and `Falloff` on `SpreadDamageWarhead` for weapons that are only supposed to affect the targeted actor (healing weapons in TS, placeholder weapons like D2k `WormJaw`, to name some examples).

(See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12605#discussion_r97385338 and following for discussion).

data.title: Attack activities should repath when projectiles are blocked from the target.
data.body:
This combines the older tickets about actors moving to a new location if their projectiles are blocked from reaching their target by walls or terrain.

Checking if a projectile will be able to hit before it fires each time wouldn't be great on performance, so we should start hy implementing new plumbing to notify `AttackBase` (and maybe other traits) *after* a projectile is blocked by actors or terrain.  The attack traits can then check for this case and trigger a repath.

Finding a cell to move too should be relatively easy:  follow the approach of `FindResources.ClosestHarvestablePos`, replacing the "can harvest cell" check with a "can fire from" check:
* Use `BlocksProjectiles.AnyBlockingActorsBetween` for walls or other blocking actors.
* Terrain (on heightmap enabled mods) is slightly trickier, but could be split into phases (are there any height changes? → does the line intercept with a bounding box defiend by `map.Height[cell]`? → check points on path across cell).

data.title: Implement airburst support to Bullet.
data.body: Has nothing to do with the regression #12628 intended to fix.

data.title: Slim down RA weapon yamls via inheritance
data.body:
Best reviewed commit by commit, I think.

Minor death type or verses changes on AA weapons are usually intentional or at least intentionally not fixed because these differences don't matter in practice.

The only changes that might be noticable, but are intentional:
- added 3 cell minimum range to cruiser cannon
- added 0.5 cell min range to missiles to avoid issues with firing at targets right above/below them.

data.title: Deploy animation doesn't play with "WithInfantryBody"
data.body:
In RA mod, I've inherited from default ^Soldier class.

	WithInfantryBody:
		DefaultAttackSequence: shoot
		UpgradeTypes: undeployed
		UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
	WithSpriteBody:
		# Need this for deploy animation.
	WithIdleOverlay@DEPLOYED:
		Sequence: deploy-shoot
		UpgradeTypes: deployed
		UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
	DeployToUpgrade:
		DeployedUpgrades: deployed
		UndeployedUpgrades: undeployed
		CanDeployOnRamps: true
		DeployAnimation: deploy

However, DeployAnimation didn't work for me until I added WithSpriteBody trait, as ^Soldier class only have WithInfantryBody. It is not documented in traits document that DeployAnimation is only read when WithSpriteBody is present.

I think this is affecting D2K mod thumper. I don't see its deploy animation.

data.title: Lookup for liblua in /opt/local/lib
data.body:
Which is required to work on SmartOS with pkgsrc

We need to lookup also for liblua at /opt/local/lib which is used as PREFIX in pkgsrc on SmartOS.

data.title: Include window size in system information prompt.
data.body: Having some statistics on screen resolutions / window sizes would be very useful when discussing issues like #12629.  We are already bumping the sysinfo version with the next release, so we should include this too.

Can we make the menu bigger, I can't really see anything.
![openra game_2017_01_26_11_54_57_948](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/22328824/7b848f7c-e3be-11e6-8877-98c682f7a35b.png)

data.title: Expose Bullet's reached-ground-altitude check to yaml.
data.body:
Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12571#pullrequestreview-17810191.

The funsies part is that apparently TS works fine already with the default value because the firing offsets are properly set up and AS doesn't work due to my lack of effort of setting them up. Values like from -192 to -1536, while working, will allow units to fire up to cliffs, which is quite close to TS with the default value already (explosions happen even higher than WW ones I think).

I guess either the LaunchAngle of 62/75 are too high in TS either OpenRA as an engine is more susceptible to firingoffset height than the WW engines were.

data.title: Fix vein attack animation moving along with target.
data.body: Fixes #12241.

data.title: Disabling weapons after deploying
data.body:
I'm trying to implement RA2 desolator for my mod, as a test for new traits.

I've ran into a trouble since it has a primary weapon and an elite primary weapon.
The trouble is, I can't disable them with upgrade conditions since the upgrade condition is already in use and I can't add deployed condition.

	Armament@primary:
		Weapon: RadBeamWeapon
		UpgradeTypes: eliteweapon, deployed
		UpgradeMaxEnabledLevel: 0
		UpgradeMaxAcceptedLevel: 1
		LocalOffset: 400,40,444
	Armament@elite:
		Weapon: RadBeamWeaponE
		UpgradeTypes: eliteweapon, deployed
		UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
		UpgradeMaxAcceptedLevel: 1
		LocalOffset: 400,40,444

	DeployToUpgrade:
		DeployedUpgrades: deployed
		CanDeployOnRamps: true
		DeployAnimation: deploy

I think UpgradeMaxEnabledLevel should become something like levelS to accept multiple levels from multiple upgrades.
